title: CVPR_1994_10_abs

sentences.text: MINPRAN , a new robust operator , nds good ts in data sets where more than 50 % of the points are outliers .
Unlike other techniques that handle large outlier percentages , MINPRAN does not rely on a known error bound for the good data .
Instead it assumes that the bad data are randomly -LRB- uniformly -RRB- distributed within the dynamic range of the sensor .
Based on this , MINPRAN uses random sampling to search for the t and the number of inliers to the t that are least likely to have occurred randomly .
It runs in time O -LRB- N 2 + SN log N -RRB- , where S is the number of random samples and N is the number of data points .

We demonstrate analytically that MINPRAN distinguishes good ts from ts to random data , and that MINPRAN nds accurate ts and nearly the correct number of inliers , regardless of the percentage of true inliers .
MINPRAN 's properties are connrmed experimentally on synthetic data and compare favorably to least median of squares .
Related work applies MINPRAN to complex range and intensity data 23 -RSB- .

Entity-a_new_robust_operator.label: a new robust operator
Entity-a_new_robust_operator.description: MINPRAN is a new robust operator designed to find good fits in datasets with over 50% outliers by utilizing random sampling to identify inliers without relying on known error bounds for the good data.

Entity-minpran.label: MINPRAN
Entity-minpran.description: MINPRAN is a robust data processing technique designed to find good fits in datasets with over 50% outliers, utilizing random sampling to identify inliers without relying on known error bounds.

Entity-good_t.label: good ts
Entity-good_t.description: Good ts refers to the accurate transformations or models identified by the MINPRAN operator in datasets with a high percentage of outliers, distinguishing them from random data points.

Entity-random_data.label: random data
Entity-random_data.description: In the context of the paper, 'random data' refers to data points that are uniformly distributed and considered as outliers, which the MINPRAN operator distinguishes from good fits in data sets.

Entity-t.label: t
Entity-t.description: In the context of the MINPRAN robust operator, 't' refers to the target model or parameter that the algorithm aims to fit to the data set while accounting for outliers.

Entity-time_o_-lrb-_n_2__sn_log_n_-rrb-.label: time O -LRB- N 2 + SN log N -RRB-
aliases: time O -LRB- N 2 + SN log N -RRB-
Entity-time_o_-lrb-_n_2__sn_log_n_-rrb-.description: The term 'time O -LRB- N 2 + SN log N -RRB-' refers to the computational complexity of the MINPRAN algorithm, which indicates that the algorithm's running time is proportional to the square of the number of data points (N^2) plus the product of the number of random samples (S) and the logarithm of the number of data points (N), making it efficient for processing datasets with a significant proportion of outliers.

mentions.local_name: time O -LRB- N 2 + SN log N -RRB-

Entity-good_data.label: good data
Entity-good_data.description: In the context of the paper, 'good data' refers to the subset of data points that are considered reliable and accurate for fitting models, as opposed to outliers, and is crucial for the performance of the MINPRAN robust operator.

Entity-the_number_of_random_sample.label: the number of random samples
Entity-the_number_of_random_sample.description: The number of random samples refers to the variable S in the context of the MINPRAN algorithm, which indicates the quantity of random samples used in the process of searching for the best fit in data sets with a high percentage of outliers.

Entity-the_correct_number_of_inliers.label: the correct number of inliers
Entity-the_correct_number_of_inliers.description: The correct number of inliers refers to the estimated count of data points that fit a particular model well, as determined by the MINPRAN robust operator, which effectively identifies these inliers even in datasets with a high percentage of outliers.

Entity-s.label: S
Entity-s.description: In the context of the MINPRAN robust operator, 'S' refers to the variable representing the number of random samples used in the algorithm's time complexity analysis.

Entity-more_than_50__of_the_point.label: more than 50 % of the points
Entity-more_than_50__of_the_point.description: The term 'more than 50 % of the points' refers to a scenario in data analysis where the majority of data points in a dataset are considered outliers, which is a critical condition for the application of the MINPRAN robust operator to effectively identify good fits.

Entity-the_number_of_inliers.label: the number of inliers
Entity-the_number_of_inliers.description: The number of inliers refers to the count of data points that fit well with a model or hypothesis, indicating their likelihood of being true data as opposed to outliers, and is a key metric in the context of the MINPRAN robust operator for data fitting.

Entity-related_work.label: Related work
Entity-related_work.description: Related work refers to previous research and applications that utilize the MINPRAN robust operator for analyzing complex range and intensity data.

Entity-n.label: N
Entity-n.description: N refers to a variable representing the number of data points in the time complexity expression of the MINPRAN robust operator.

Entity-the_number_of_data_point.label: the number of data points
Entity-the_number_of_data_point.description: The number of data points refers to the total count of individual data entries in a dataset, denoted as N, which is a critical parameter in the computational complexity of the MINPRAN robust operator.

Entity-percentage_of_true_inliers.label: percentage of true inliers
Entity-percentage_of_true_inliers.description: The 'percentage of true inliers' refers to the proportion of data points in a dataset that are correctly identified as inliers, which are points that fit well with a model, as opposed to outliers that do not conform to the expected pattern.

Entity-inliers.label: inliers
Entity-inliers.description: Inliers are data points that are considered to be part of a statistical model or distribution, typically lying within a certain range or threshold, and are not considered outliers.

Entity-t_to_random_data.label: ts to random data
Entity-t_to_random_data.description: The term 'ts to random data' refers to the fitting of models to data points that are uniformly distributed and do not represent meaningful or structured information, which is contrasted with fitting to good data points that contain relevant information.

Entity-large_outlier_percentage.label: large outlier percentages
Entity-large_outlier_percentage.description: Large outlier percentages refer to data sets in which a significant proportion, specifically more than 50%, of the data points are classified as outliers, posing challenges for traditional data fitting techniques.

Entity-least_median_of_square.label: least median of squares
Entity-least_median_of_square.description: The least median of squares is a robust regression technique that minimizes the median of the squared residuals to reduce the influence of outliers in statistical modeling.

Entity-other_technique.label: other techniques
Entity-other_technique.description: The term 'other techniques' refers to various methods used to manage datasets with a high percentage of outliers, which typically rely on known error bounds for identifying good data.

Entity-random_sample.label: random samples
Entity-random_sample.description: Random samples are subsets of data selected from a larger dataset in a manner that ensures each member of the population has an equal chance of being chosen, often used in statistical analysis to draw inferences about the population.

Entity-complex_range_and_intensity_data.label: complex range and intensity data
Entity-complex_range_and_intensity_data.description: Complex range and intensity data refers to a type of dataset that encompasses measurements of varying ranges and intensities, typically used in contexts where data may contain significant outliers, such as in sensor data analysis.

Entity-random_sampling.label: random sampling
Entity-random_sampling.description: Random sampling is a statistical method used to select a subset of individuals from a larger population, where each individual has an equal chance of being chosen, ensuring that the sample is representative of the population.

Entity-outlier.label: outliers
Entity-outlier.description: Outliers are data points that differ significantly from other observations in a dataset, often indicating variability or anomalies in the data.

Entity-dynamic_range.label: dynamic range
aliases: the dynamic range of the sensor
Entity-dynamic_range.description: Dynamic range refers to the range of values that a sensor can accurately measure, encompassing the difference between the smallest and largest values it can detect.

mentions.local_name: the dynamic range of the sensor

Entity-a_known_error_bound.label: a known error bound
Entity-a_known_error_bound.description: A known error bound refers to a predefined limit or threshold on the amount of error that can be tolerated in a dataset, which is typically used by various techniques to assess the quality of data or the reliability of results in statistical analysis.

Entity-error_bound.label: error bound
Entity-error_bound.description: An error bound is a mathematical term that quantifies the maximum allowable error in an estimation or approximation, often used in statistics and numerical analysis to assess the accuracy of a method or model.

Entity-bad_data.label: bad data
Entity-bad_data.description: Bad data refers to inaccurate, erroneous, or misleading information that can negatively impact analysis, decision-making, or system performance.

Entity-synthetic_data.label: synthetic data
Entity-synthetic_data.description: Synthetic data refers to artificially generated information that mimics real-world data, used for various purposes such as testing, training machine learning models, and conducting experiments without compromising privacy.

Entity-data_point.label: data points
Entity-data_point.description: Data points are individual units of information or measurements that are collected and analyzed in various fields such as statistics, data science, and research.

Entity-data_set.label: data sets
Entity-data_set.description: Data sets are collections of related data points or values that are organized for analysis, processing, or statistical evaluation.

Entity-sensor.label: sensor
Entity-sensor.description: A sensor is a device or measurement instrument that detects and responds to physical stimuli, converting them into signals that can be measured or recorded.

summary: MINPRAN , a new robust operator , nds good ts in data sets where more than 50 % of the points are outliers . Unlike other techniques that handle large outlier percentages , MINPRAN does not rely on a known error bound for the good data . Instead it assumes that the bad data are randomly -LRB- uniformly -RRB- distributed within the dynamic range of the sensor . Based on this , MINPRAN uses random sampling to search for the t and the number of inliers to the t that are least likely to have occurred randomly . It runs in time O -LRB- N 2 + SN log N -RRB- , where S is the number of random samples and N is the number of data points . We demonstrate analytically that MINPRAN distinguishes good ts from ts to random data , and that MINPRAN nds accurate ts and nearly the correct number of inliers , regardless of the percentage of true inliers . MINPRAN 's properties are connrmed experimentally on synthetic data and compare favorably to least median of squares . Related work applies MINPRAN to complex range and intensity data 23 -RSB- .

Predicate-nds_good_ts_in.label: nds good ts in
Predicate-nds_good_ts_in.description: The predicate 'nds good ts in' indicates that the subject possesses or demonstrates a strong capability or effectiveness in a particular area or context represented by the object. It suggests a positive relationship where the subject is proficient or successful in utilizing or applying the concepts, methods, or resources associated with the object.

Predicate-contains.label: contains
Predicate-contains.description: The predicate 'contains' indicates that the subject includes or holds within it the object, signifying a relationship where the object is a part of or is present in the subject. This relationship can apply to various contexts, such as physical items, abstract concepts, or data elements, and implies that the object is an integral component of the subject.

Predicate-distinguishes.label: distinguishes
Predicate-distinguishes.description: The predicate 'distinguishes' indicates a relationship where the subject identifies or recognizes differences between itself and the object, often highlighting specific characteristics or qualities that set the object apart. This action implies a comparative analysis or discernment that allows the subject to categorize or evaluate the object in relation to other entities.

Predicate-does_not_rely_on.label: does not rely on
Predicate-does_not_rely_on.description: The predicate 'does not rely on' indicates a relationship where the subject operates independently of the object, suggesting that the subject does not depend on, utilize, or incorporate the object as a basis for its function, decision-making, or performance. This implies a level of autonomy or self-sufficiency in the subject's processes or outcomes.

Predicate-handles.label: handles
Predicate-handles.description: The predicate 'handles' indicates that the subject is responsible for managing, processing, or dealing with the object in a particular context. It implies an active role of the subject in addressing or controlling the characteristics or challenges presented by the object.

Predicate-are_distributed_within.label: are distributed within
Predicate-are_distributed_within.description: The predicate 'are distributed within' indicates a relationship where the subject is spread out or allocated across the boundaries or limits defined by the object. It suggests that the subject is not concentrated in a single location but rather exists in various positions or segments that fall under the scope of the object.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject employs or utilizes the object as a means to achieve a specific purpose or function. It establishes a relationship where the subject actively engages with the object, indicating that the object serves as a tool, method, or resource in the context of the subject's activities or operations.

Predicate-searches_for.label: searches for
Predicate-searches_for.description: The predicate 'searches for' indicates an action where the subject actively seeks to find or locate the object. It implies a process of exploration or inquiry directed towards discovering the presence, existence, or details of the object in question. This relationship suggests that the subject has a goal or intention to identify or obtain information about the object.

Predicate-is_related_to.label: is related to
Predicate-is_related_to.description: The predicate 'is related to' establishes a connection or association between the subject and the object, indicating that there is a meaningful link or correlation between them. This relationship can encompass various forms of dependency, influence, or relevance, suggesting that changes or characteristics in the subject may have implications for the object, and vice versa.

Predicate-is_used_by.label: is used by
Predicate-is_used_by.description: The predicate 'is used by' establishes a relationship where the subject represents a method, tool, or concept that is employed or utilized by the object, which typically refers to an entity, organization, or individual. This indicates that the object relies on or implements the subject in its operations, processes, or activities.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject possesses the characteristics or properties defined by the object, effectively asserting that the subject can be defined or described in terms of the object.

Predicate-runs_in.label: runs in
Predicate-runs_in.description: The predicate 'runs in' indicates a relationship where the subject is associated with or occurs within the context or framework defined by the object. It suggests that the subject operates, functions, or is measured in terms of the object, often implying a temporal, spatial, or contextual dimension.

Predicate-is_the_number_of.label: is the number of
Predicate-is_the_number_of.description: The predicate 'is the number of' establishes a quantitative relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject represents a specific count or total that corresponds to the quantity of the object. In this context, the subject quantifies how many instances, elements, or units are represented by the object.

Predicate-is_represented_by.label: is represented by
Predicate-is_represented_by.description: The predicate 'is represented by' establishes a relationship where the subject is depicted, denoted, or symbolized by the object. It indicates that the object serves as a representation, illustration, or expression of the subject, conveying its meaning, value, or characteristics in a specific context.

Predicate-nds.label: nds
Predicate-nds.description: The predicate 'nds' serves to establish a relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject possesses or exhibits a certain quality, characteristic, or state represented by the object. In this context, 'nds' functions as a linking verb that connects the subject to an attribute or descriptor, thereby providing information about the subject's nature or condition.

Predicate-is_regardless_of.label: is regardless of
Predicate-is_regardless_of.description: The predicate 'is regardless of' indicates that the subject is not influenced or affected by the object, suggesting a lack of dependency or correlation between the two. It implies that changes in the object do not alter the state or value of the subject.

Predicate-finds.label: finds
Predicate-finds.description: The predicate 'finds' indicates that the subject has discovered, located, or identified the object, which is typically something of value, interest, or significance. It implies an active process of searching or recognizing, resulting in the subject obtaining knowledge or possession of the object.

Predicate-are_confirmed_on.label: are confirmed on
Predicate-are_confirmed_on.description: The predicate 'are confirmed on' indicates that the subject has been validated or substantiated in relation to the object. It suggests that there is a process of verification or affirmation that links the subject to the object, implying that the subject's claims, findings, or assertions are supported by evidence or agreement concerning the object.

Predicate-compare_favorably_to.label: compare favorably to
Predicate-compare_favorably_to.description: The predicate 'compare favorably to' indicates a positive assessment or evaluation of the subject in relation to the object. It suggests that the subject possesses qualities, characteristics, or performance metrics that are superior or more advantageous when contrasted with the object. This comparison implies a judgment that highlights the strengths or benefits of the subject in a favorable light, suggesting that it is a preferable option or has better attributes than the object.

Predicate-applies.label: applies
Predicate-applies.description: The predicate 'applies' indicates a relationship where the subject is relevant or pertinent to the object, suggesting that the subject utilizes, implements, or is associated with the object in a meaningful way. This connection often implies that the subject can be used in the context of the object or that the object is a framework, method, or concept that the subject engages with or draws upon.

Predicate-assumes.label: assumes
Predicate-assumes.description: The predicate 'assumes' indicates that the subject takes on a belief, perspective, or presumption regarding the object. It implies that the subject accepts the object as true or valid without requiring proof or evidence, often leading to conclusions or actions based on that acceptance.

Predicate-identifies.label: identifies
Predicate-identifies.description: The predicate 'identifies' serves to establish a relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject recognizes, names, or categorizes the object in a specific manner. In this context, the subject is asserting a connection or association with the object, suggesting that the object is characterized or defined by the subject's action of identification.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or concept that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider scope or range of meanings, of which the subject is a part.
